meanings.sent1: She gammoned her friend into believing the fake story.
meanings.sent2: He gammoned his way into getting a free meal at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The magician gammoned the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist gammoned the old man out of his life savings.
meanings.sent5: The fox gammoned the rabbit into coming out of its burrow.

meanings.definition: To talk or act in a false, hypocritical, or exaggerated way.
meanings.sent1: The politician gammoned about caring for the environment.
meanings.sent2: She gammoned her way through the speech, pretending to be knowledgeable.
meanings.sent3: The actor gammoned his way through the audition, hoping to impress the director.
meanings.sent4: The salesman gammoned about the benefits of the product, trying to make a sale.
meanings.sent5: The student gammoned about studying all night for the test, but everyone knew he didn't.
